input.description: adapter name [Optional] The name of the adapter that is enabled on the Peer. The default adapter name is HPSEActor

1. Edits the product health rmanbackup schedule Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>edit</command> <category>configuration</category> <process-id>update-schedule</process-id> <command-arguments> <producthealth> <rmanbackup/> <nextrun-date>2010-07-22</nextrun-date> <nextrun-time>12:00</nextrun-time> <interval-frequency>1</interval-frequency> <interval-duration>day</interval-duration> <enable/> </producthealth> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. producthealth[Required] Indicates the producthealth schedules rmanbackup[Required] Indicates that producthealth rmanbackup schedule be edited nextrun-date[Optional] New date when the schedule will run. Date Format: yyyy-mm-dd nextrun-time[Optional] New time when the schedule will run. Time Format(24-hour): hh:mm interval-frequency[Optional] Frequency of schedule. Although interval-frequency can be as minimum as 1 second, it is recommended that the minimum frequency should be provided as one day. The reason being that database backup is a long process and can take lot of time to run if the database contains lots of data. Also, if the interval is provided less than 1 day the results can be unpredictable. interval-duration[Optional] Frequency units of schedule.Valid values: second, minute, hour, day, week. enable[Optional] Indincates that schedule should be enabled
2. Resets report cache schedule parameters Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>edit</command> <category>configuration</category> <process-id>update-schedule</process-id> <command-arguments> <reports> <cache/> <nextrun-date>2010-07-22</nextrun-date> <nextrun-time>12:00</nextrun-time> <interval-frequency>1</interval-frequency> <interval-duration>day</interval-duration> <enable/> </reports> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. reports[Required] Indicates the reports schedules cache[Required] Indicates that reports reports cache be reset nextrun-date[Optional] New date when the schedule will run. Date Format: yyyy-mm-dd nextrun-time[Optional] New time when the schedule will run. Time Format(24-hour): hh:mm interval-frequency[Optional] Frequency of schedule interval-duration[Optional] Frequency units of schedule. Minimum frequency should be atleast one hour. For ex. In minutes the minimum value should be: 60 minute. Valid values: second, minute, hour, day, week. enable[Optional] Indincates that schedule should be enabled
3. Resets report cleanup schedule parameters Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>edit</command> <category>configuration</category> <process-id>update-schedule</process-id> <command-arguments> <reports> <cleanup/> <nextrun-date>2010-07-22</nextrun-date> <nextrun-time>12:00</nextrun-time> <interval-frequency>1</interval-frequency> <interval-duration>day</interval-duration> <enable/> </reports> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. reports[Required] Indicates the reports schedules cleanup[Required] Indicates that reports cleanup schedule be reset nextrun-date[Optional] New date when the schedule will run. Date Format: yyyy-mm-dd nextrun-time[Optional] New time when the schedule will run. Time Format(24-hour): hh:mm interval-frequency[Optional] Frequency of schedule interval-duration[Optional] Frequency units of schedule. Minimum frequency should be atleast one hour. For ex. In minutes the minimum value should be: 60 minute. Valid values: second, minute, hour, day, week. enable[Optional] Indincates that schedule should be enabled
4. Resets report data aging schedule parameters Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>edit</command> <category>configuration</category> <process-id>update-schedule</process-id> <command-arguments> <reports> <dataaging-id>1011</dataaging-id> <nextrun-date>2010-07-22</nextrun-date> <nextrun-time>12:00</nextrun-time> <interval-frequency>1</interval-frequency> <interval-duration>day</interval-duration> <enable/> </reports> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. reports[Required] Indicates the reports schedules dataaging-id[Required] id of the reports dataging schedule that needs to be reset nextrun-date[Optional] New date when the schedule will run. Date Format: yyyy-mm-dd nextrun-time[Optional] New time when the schedule will run. Time Format(24-hour): hh:mm interval-frequency[Optional] Frequency of schedule interval-duration[Optional] Frequency units of schedule. Minimum frequency should be atleast one hour. For ex. In minutes the minimum value should be: 60 minute. Valid values: second, minute, hour, day, week. enable[Optional] Indincates that schedule should be enabled
5. Resets report data collection schedule parameters Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>edit</command> <category>configuration</category> <process-id>update-schedule</process-id> <command-arguments> <reports> <datacollection-id>1011</datacollection-id> <nextrun-date>2010-07-22</nextrun-date> <nextrun-time>12:00</nextrun-time> <interval-frequency>1</interval-frequency> <interval-duration>day</interval-duration> <enable/> </reports> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. reports[Required] Indicates the reports schedules datacollection-id[Required] id of the reports datacollection schedule that needs to be reset nextrun-date[Optional] New date when the schedule will run. Date Format: yyyy-mm-dd nextrun-time[Optional] New time when the schedule will run. Time Format(24-hour): hh:mm interval-frequency[Optional] Frequency of schedule. For Minutes - Application States: "The given number has to be between 1 and 518400" For Hours- Application States: "The given number has to be between 1 and 8640" For Days - Application States: "The given number has to be between 1 and 360" interval-duration[Optional] Frequency units of schedule. Minimum frequency should be atleast one minute. Valid values: minute, hour, day. enable[Optional] Indincates that schedule should be enabled
6. Resets global reporter schedule parameters Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>edit</command> <category>configuration</category> <process-id>update-schedule</process-id> <command-arguments> <reports> <globalreporter/> <nextrun-date>2010-07-22</nextrun-date> <nextrun-time>12:00</nextrun-time> <interval-frequency>1</interval-frequency> <interval-duration>day</interval-duration> <enable/> </reports> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. reports[Required] Indicates the reports schedules globalreporter[Required] Indicates that globalreporter schedule be reset nextrun-date[Optional] New date when the schedule will run. Date Format: yyyy-mm-dd nextrun-time[Optional] New time when the schedule will run. Time Format(24-hour): hh:mm interval-frequency[Optional] Frequency of schedule interval-duration[Optional] Frequency units of schedule. Minimum frequency should be atleast one hour. For ex. In minutes the minimum value should be: 60 minute. Valid values: second, minute, hour, day, week. enable[Optional] Indincates that schedule should be enabled

documentation.description:
This wrapper supports the following requirements:-
1. Edits the product health rmanbackup schedule. 2. Resets report cache schedule parameters. 3. Resets report cleanup schedule parameters. 4. Resets report data aging schedule parameters. 5. Resets report data collection schedule parameters. 6. Resets global reporter schedule parameters.
